text: {{Infobox settlement | settlement_type = City | image_skyline = | imagesize = | image_caption = | nickname = Waffi, Waff Town | motto = | image_map = | mapsize = | map_caption = | image_map1 = | mapsize1 = | map_caption1 = | pushpin_map = Nigeria | pushpin_label_position = bottom | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Nigeria | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Nigeria | subdivision_type1 = State | subdivision_type2 = Local Government | subdivision_type4 = | subdivision_name1 = Delta State | subdivision_name2 = Warri South LGA | leader_title = Executive Governor | leader_name = Ifeanyi Okowa | leader_title1 = | leader_name1 = | unit_pref = Imperial | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | elevation_ft = | population_total = 2 Million | population_as_of = 2016 est | population_footnotes = | population_density_km2 = | population_density_sq_mi = | population_urban = | population_density_urban_km2 = | population_density_urban_sq_mi = | population_metro = | population_density_metro_km2 = | population_density_metro_sq_mi = | population_note = | postal_code_type = | postal_code = | area_code = | footnotes = | image_dot_map = | dot_mapsize = | dot_map_caption = | dot_x = | dot_y = | government_footnotes = | leader_title2 = | leader_name2 = | leader_title3 = | leader_name3 = | leader_title4 = | leader_name4 = | timezone = | utc_offset = | timezone_DST = | utc_offset_DST = | blank_name = Climate | blank_info = Am | demographics_type1 = Demographics | demographics1_title1 = Ethnicities | demographics1_info1 = Urhobo, Itsekiri, Ijaw | demographics1_title2 = Languages | demographics1_info2 = Pidgin English, Urhobo, Itsekiri, and Ijaw | demographics1_title3 = Religions | demographics1_info3 = 95% Christianity, 3% Traditional African religions, 2% Islam | official_name = Warri | native_name_lang = }} Warri is a city in Delta State, Nigeria. It is very rich in oil. Its biggest market is called Igbudu Market. ==Notable people== *Ayo Oritsejafor, former CAN President *Nedum Onuoha, footballer *Isaiah Ogedegbe, pastor and blogger ==References== Category:Cities in Nigeria Category:Delta State
